blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: I have decided to unfollow a lot of Dany fans because the constant Jon hate fest and desire to see his character destroyed and...
body:
I have decided to unfollow a lot of Dany fans because the constant Jon hate fest and desire to see his character destroyed and dead is getting tiresome. Nothing personal here, but he continues to be my favorite character and considering every character has bad writing, the intense hate he is getting for being a man is starting to get boring.

Dany fans go on about everything Dany has done for the North. And Jon kept his word to her. He has supported her 100%. In front of everyone - his backstabbing family and men - he plainly makes it clear he is on her side. He fought for her till the very end. He rejected attempts by Varys to put him on the throne.

The ONLY only mistake he did was to trust the backstabbing, devious snake that’s his sister with his parentage - because he thought the Starks deserved to know about him and their father. Sansa knew he loved Dany and still planned to destroy his relationship and her for selfish reasons.

But I never see any criticism towards Sansa from Dany fans. It’s Jon that gets all the hate - because he’s a man.

The only people who actually plotted against Dany were Sansa and Varys. No one else. The only person who fought against her was Cersei.

Are Dany fans hating on him because he could not get past the incest factor? You guys go on and on about how Jorah was not entitled to Dany’s romantic love and then make long posts angry about Jon for not being able to fully love Dany that way.  Just like Jorah was not entitled to Dany’s love, Dany is not entitled to Jon’s. Jon bend the knee after seeing she was a good queen and kept his word to her - bringing Northern soldiers south to fight for her. And he did love her, in his own way. Like Jorah did.

Maybe wait till the finale next week before making all those long posts about how it’s unfair that Jon’s going to get everything Dany had and how he does not deserve the Iron Throne and deserve to rule and it’s all sexist bs etc. Is D&D’s writing sexist? No doubt. But Jon is hardly the character who is winning here. That’s going to be most likely D&D’s faves Tyrion and Sansa.

blog.name: dailyjonaryadany
blog.title: theirs is the song of ice and fire

summary:
Hi everyone. 
In the days leading up to the finale, we asked ourselves what would become of this blog. The show made certain...
body:
Hi everyone.

In the days leading up to the finale, we asked ourselves what would become of this blog. The show made certain decisions that we hadn’t anticipated, and it called the purpose of the blog into question.

After the episode on Sunday and the confirmation by leaks for what’s to come, we’d like to take a moment to clarify our stance regarding dailyjonaryadany and its future.

The admins started this blog because we felt a connection between Jon, Arya and Dany, and we wanted a place to celebrate that connection as well as their own remarkable individual characters. It’s a place dedicated to our love and our appreciation for them, their parallels, and the bonds that existed and were forged with each other.

That has not changed, and it will not change.

The show ending may not be as we’d hoped, but it’s only a small part of what has been an incredibly complex and emotional journey. Jon, Arya and Dany have come so far, and regardless of spontaneous plot twists or subverted expectations, they’ll always be the characters we grew to love so deeply and who serve as inspirations in their own ways.

So we’re keeping this blog running, because J/A/D fans and the characters themselves deserve the positivity and the appreciation, whatever happens.

After all, there’s always the books.

Thanks for sticking with us, and we hope you’ll stick around for a little while longer. 💜

summary: The only reason I can see "the bell snap" making a fraction of sense is if Dany thought that she was a "savior" for KL people...
body: The only reason I can see “the bell snap” making a fraction of sense is if Dany thought that she was a “savior” for KL people but they still rang the bell. The bell is surrender - you do not surrender to your savior, you surrender to the enemy. She wanted a moment of triumph but got only fear.

reblog.comment: The only reason I can see “the bell snap” making a fraction of sense is if Dany thought that she was a “savior” for KL people but they still rang the bell. The bell is surrender - you do not surrender to your savior, you surrender to the enemy. She wanted a moment of triumph but got only fear.

trail.content_raw: The only reason I can see “the bell snap” making a fraction of sense is if Dany thought that she was a “savior” for KL people but they still rang the bell. The bell is surrender - you do not surrender to your savior, you surrender to the enemy. She wanted a moment of triumph but got only fear.
trail.content: The only reason I can see “the bell snap” making a fraction of sense is if Dany thought that she was a “savior” for KL people but they still rang the bell. The bell is surrender - you do not surrender to your savior, you surrender to the enemy. She wanted a moment of triumph but got only fear.

summary: I hope everyone in the jonerys fandom knows:
body:
I hope everyone in the jonerys fandom knows:

How grateful I am to engage with you via fanfiction, on here, or in any other way. Regardless of what’s happening in the show, this fandom has some fantastic authors, artists, and people. Five episodes can’t take away years of creativity.


Feel free to add what want everyone to know.

summary: // Stormborn // This painting conveys a little bit of what I'm feeling after the second-to-last episode of the entire show has...
caption:
// Stormborn //

This painting conveys a little bit of what I’m feeling after the second-to-last episode of the entire show has devastatingly shattered my favorite character! Dany will always be my queen.

Daenerys is from GOT / belongs to GRRM.

PS & Cintiq 24 Pro.  Please do not copy/repost/edit - reblogs appreciated. <3

blog.name: yahoder
blog.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies.The man who never reads lives only one." - George RR Martin

summary: Listen, ignoring the arguments over Dany’s decision in this episode... We FINALLY get the dragon action I feel like this show...
caption:
Listen, ignoring the arguments over Dany’s decision in this episode…

We FINALLY get the dragon action I feel like this show has largely been missing. Drogon and Dany conquered the largest city in the country, destroyed one of the strongest fleets in Westeros and took out most of the Golden Company SINGLE HANDEDLY.

This scene explains how Aegon the Conqueror and his sisters conquered Westeros with 1500 men; Dragons. They are an unparalleled power. 

These scenes were just visually amazing to watch.
